fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, International co-operation and development, Customs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
organisation_name: International Chamber of Commerce in Belgium (ICC Belgium)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: - INTERNATIONAL CHAMBER OF COMMERCE (ICC), THE WORLD BUSINESS ORGANIZATION
goals__remit:
ICC Belgium is a national committee of the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC). These national bodies comprise leading companies and business associations in their countries or territories. National committees shape ICC policies and alert their governments to international business concerns. ICC provides a voice for business at inter-governmental level and is the only business organisation with UN Observer Status. 
ICC Belgium is the representative office of ICC in Brussels and in the Belgium, supporting business interests and working in partnership with business groups and government. 
 
ICC has three central functions, to: 
 - Promote responsible free trade 
 - Provide the rules and standards that govern international business 
 - Help companies and States settle international disputes
